comments:
I have had to Force Quit Eclipse due to it hanging.  When I try to relaunch, I get a 
NoClassDefFoundError.
This time it is looking for org.eclipse.core.resources.IProject.  It appears that something gets hosed 
when
force quitting - although I have been able to quit Eclipse on Windows, and can restart without
losing anything (other than perhaps the last thing i was editing).  I have to totally reconstruct
a new .metadata, and recheck out all my projects, etc., copy over any changed files, and this
takes alot of time and is prone to errors.  I had thought that perhaps Eclipse 3.0RC1 was too
flaky, so I had to switch back to 2.1.3, and the same thing occurred!  (See bug 68095).
So, I'm stuck with having to reconstruct my workspace every time Eclipse hangs.

I'm running Mac OS X (10.3.4)
dual-proc G5
1GB memory
-------------------.log entry
